ibis.util

Class ClassLister

  • java.lang.Object
    • ibis.util.ClassLister

  • public class ClassLister
extends java.lang.Object
    This class exports a method for searching either the classpath or a specified list of directories for jar-files with a specified name in the Manifest.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> getClassList(java.lang.String attribName)
      Returns a list of classes for the specified attribute name.
      java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> getClassList(java.lang.String attribName, java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
      Returns a list of classes for the specified attribute name.
      static ClassLister getClassLister(java.lang.String dirList)
      Obtains a ClassLister for the specified directory list.
      protected void readJarFiles()
      This method reads all jar files from the classpath, and stores them in a list that can be searched for specific names later on.
      protected void readJarFiles(java.lang.String dirList)
      This method reads all jar files found in the specified directories, and stores them in a list that can be searched for specific names later on.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getClassLister

        public static ClassLister getClassLister(java.lang.String dirList)
        Obtains a ClassLister for the specified directory list. All jar files found in the specified directories are used. if dirList is null, all jar files from the classpath are used instead.
        Parameters:
        dirList - a list of directories, or null, in which the classpath is used to find jar files.
        Returns:
        the required ClassLister.

      • readJarFiles

        protected void readJarFiles()
        This method reads all jar files from the classpath, and stores them in a list that can be searched for specific names later on.

      • readJarFiles

        protected void readJarFiles(java.lang.String dirList)
        This method reads all jar files found in the specified directories, and stores them in a list that can be searched for specific names later on.
        Parameters:
        dirList - list of directories to search, separator is java.io.File.pathSeparator.

      • getClassList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> getClassList(java.lang.String attribName)
        Returns a list of classes for the specified attribute name. The specified manifest attribute name is assumed to be mapped to a comma-separated list of class names. All jar files in the classpath are scanned for the specified manifest attribute name, and the attribute values are loaded.
        Parameters:
        attribName - the manifest attribute name.
        Returns:
        the list of classes.

      • getClassList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> getClassList(java.lang.String attribName,
                                                       java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Returns a list of classes for the specified attribute name. The specified manifest attribute name is assumed to be mapped to a comma-separated list of class names. All jar files in the classpath are scanned for the specified manifest attribute name, and the attribute values are loaded. The classes thus obtained should be extensions of the specified class, or, if it is an interface, implementations of it.
        Parameters:
        attribName - the manifest attribute name.
        clazz - the class of which the returned classes are implementations or extensions.
        Returns:
        the list of classes.
